item.description:
In "Venus", an aged actor whose glory days are far behind attempts to seduce his friend's grand-niece . After she rejects his amorous advances, a friendship is forged and as he attempts to show her the wisdom of his age, he falters, in this whimsical May-December romantic comedy. The screenplay was written by Henri Kureishi ("My Beautiful Laundrette").

Movies these days so rarely give central roles to actors over 50. With "Venus", there are three such roles and features two of the best actors from years gone by, with Peter O'Toole as the cad, and Vanessa Redgrave as his ex-wife, both of whom are over 70.

Here is a review of this somewhat overlooked movie that The All-Movie Guide gave 4 Stars: http://www.nypost.com...

After the movie, Tom will hold a meetup signup near the front row and then its off to a local cafe to discuss.
item.name: Venus- A Comedy about Life, Lust, and (perhaps) a bit of Wisdom
